column5: Anybody tried Hull Hugr boat fenders? http://www.amazon.ca/HH-1CB-Hull-Hugr-Contour-Fender/dp/B000OF3J22/ref=pd_rhf_dp_p_img_2  Seems no matter how I set up the regular cylinder types, and whatever size I use, when the boat is below the top of the dock - particularly at Jordan where the concrete dock is, the boat will bounce against the dock. Wondering if the above will be the cure.
Ypu could rig your bumpers horizontally across the top of the gunwhale. Basically a line running the length of the boat with bumpers on it.
Those look pretty good.  If you end up trying them out, let us know if they work!
Bet they work like a charm and would be easier to store.
Those look pretty good.  If you end up trying them out, let us know if they work!  x2. Please.
I have them for my seadoo and the work good, easy to store don't take up a lot of space
They look good.Anyone try those stowaway holdaway style things?   http://stowawayholdaway.com/

Last September  we were at  Muskenonje Lodge the same time Italo L.  was there to shoot a show. He had the same fenders and they looked mighty fine. What I like is they would take up less space to store than the traditional bumpers as they will lay flat as Bondar said above.
I have a pair.. but I use them to jam under my floats on rock faces..
